text:
Raskolnikov rose abruptly, cap in hand. 

“Porfiry Petrovitch,” he said, irritation seeping through his voice. “You wanted inquiries. Ask me, or let me go. I have no time.”

Porfiry shifted nervously. 

“What do you mean? What shall I question you about?” 

“Examine me properly, or I leave.” 

“Please, don’t disturb yourself!” Porfiry fussed, urging him to sit. 

“Enough! I’m sick of this!” Raskolnikov shouted, anger boiling over. 

“Goodbye, then. We have nothing more to discuss.”

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Raskolnikov feels trapped and irritated during a tense encounter with Porfiry Petrovitch, who seems to have ulterior motives for their meeting.
